Catchup


  • Rotherham (h) 0-0
  • Swansea (a) 2-1
  • Rat sacked


Stoke talking points


  • Fiorini back, Rogers & Poveda in, Bowler out.  Looked like a 4-3-3?
  • Glaring Gayle miss - defence all over the place
  • Poveda GOAL! Rogers key to the move?
  • Maxi’s Smallbone save (Mitch lookalike should have scored) vital save at that period in the game
  • CJ on for Fiorini - thoughts on the logic here?
  • Who goes on to drag a glorious chance wide on 58 mins
  • Superman Connolly clearance
  • Hat-trick full-back change!! OFF: Poveda, Rogers, Lyons ON: Thompson, Garbutt, Gabriel. 62 mins.  
  • Another Maxi worldly save on 65 mins
  • Smallbone ‘celebrations’ on 76 min free-kick that “went in”
  • Six LONG minutes. Six mins of added time. Did anyone feel nervous at injury time?
  • Emotional scenes at the final whistle.  Lots of hugging around the ground!


Blackburn preview

It's Thursday 9th February 2022, in this evening's show we run the rule over Tuesday’s two-all draw against Huddersfield as the ‘Pool got out of jail, mainly thanks to Josh Bowler.  We also look ahead to another massive relegation six-pointer against Rotherham this Saturday at Bloomfield Road.


Huddersfield reaction


  • Balloon popping lineup - What was he thinking setting up like this
  • Maxwell wonder save -  tipped one round the post
  • Carey missed - should have bundled home after a good cross from CJ
  • Goode off, good? Replaced by Lyons.  Did this change our approach?
  • Nelson ‘av it - Matty Pearson slotting home after Nelson skies a clearance
  • A dreadful first half - worst of the season?
  • Rogers is on for Carey at HT.  Thoughts on what he was trying to achieve?
  • Big Gaz is off - FOUR game ban now.  Is it time to say goodbye to Madine after this?
  • Bowler for CJ - on 71 mins.  Changed the game?
  • Lyons goal on 82 mins - a great finish after good work from Bowler
  • Josh Koroma curls one in from distance.  Lyons at fault for affording too much space?
  • Bowler equaliser 90 mins after great work from Rogers and Husband
  • Incredible support - did that get us over the line?


Rotherham preview 


  1. They have always been a bit of a bogey side, smashed us three nil at their place.
  2. A Championship yo-yo side but according to Rotherham's chairman is the strongest squad they’ve ever had after a good window
  3. Had a good Jan window by all accounts
  4. A ‘marquee’ striker signing in Jordan Hugill from Norwich, ex Nobbe
  5. Beat Sheff United away in November and drew at home in Feb, drew at Watford and smashed Blackburn 4-0 in Jan
  6. We pick our eleven
  7. Predictions

title: Middlesbrough 3 - Blackpool 0 : REACTION
subtitle: A right hammering at the Riverside as Mick McCarthy's first league game in charge resulted in a heavy defeat
summary: Talking PointsLineup and the formation Early pressureHerded into two small blocks of seats like cattle.header onto the bar after a really soft free kick against Curtis NELSONGoode put on his arse my midget Archer, slips Macgree in and a good save from MaxwellAkpom aplomb - bamboozled Connolly and curled a beauty in. Maxwell no chanceFlash of Bowler - Great run early in the second half to set up Yates with a great finish but offsideCJ wing backing it - A beautiful cross for Yates who hits the bar. Thoughts on CJ in the left wing-back role?Akpom double - Great link play with Magrea, a great team goal. Maxwell should be quicker off his line maybe?Hat Trick...of chances - Bowler bad miss, Lyons curler chance and Yates toe poke. Had Bowler put his chance away, would anyone have seen us coming back into the game?Poevda free kick - Summed up the day for me. Free kick from great run and drive by Rogers though who again impressed. Has to start next game?Huddersfield at homeHuge, huge match. We’ve now not won a league match in 100 days.How do you think he’ll line up?Our team-----------------PATREON-----------------If you would like to help support our show and help us pay for software, hosting, equipment, etc., please consider joining our Patreon supporter program.  https://www.patreon.com/seasiderspodIn return, you'll get extra content, early releases, access to our private Patreon WhatsApp chat group, and the odd giveaway now and then.   Hosted on Acast. content.value:
Talking Points


  1. Lineup and the formation 
  2. Early pressure
  3. Herded into two small blocks of seats like cattle.
  4. header onto the bar after a really soft free kick against Curtis NELSON
  5. Goode put on his arse my midget Archer, slips Macgree in and a good save from Maxwell
  6. Akpom aplomb - bamboozled Connolly and curled a beauty in. Maxwell no chance
  7. Flash of Bowler - Great run early in the second half to set up Yates with a great finish but offside
  8. CJ wing backing it - A beautiful cross for Yates who hits the bar. Thoughts on CJ in the left wing-back role?
  9. Akpom double - Great link play with Magrea, a great team goal. Maxwell should be quicker off his line maybe?
  10. Hat Trick...of chances - Bowler bad miss, Lyons curler chance and Yates toe poke. Had Bowler put his chance away, would anyone have seen us coming back into the game?
  11. Poevda free kick - Summed up the day for me. Free kick from great run and drive by Rogers though who again impressed. Has to start next game?


Huddersfield at home


  • Huge, huge match. We’ve now not won a league match in 100 days.
  • How do you think he’ll line up?
  • Our team

title: Charlie Adam interview (part one)
subtitle: Charlie talks to us about joining the 'Pool, the Championship promotion season and Wembley glory in 2010.
summary: Recorded on Sunday 7th February 2021, this is part one of a two-part interview with ex-Blackpool FC skipper, talisman and club legend, Charlie Adam. It's Thursday 26th January 2023, in this evening show we are joined by Glen from the Total Saint Podcast who will be helping us preview this Saturdays FA Cup round 4 clash at St. Marys.  We’ll also be catching up on the latest news and signings from Bloomfield Road since the last pod.


#southampton #blackpoolfc 


Glen from Total Saints Podcast


  1. Welcome Glen, how long and why are you a Saints fan?
  2. Tell us about the Total Saints Podcast and how you got involved with it
  3. Tell us how its going under Nathan Jones and what did you think of the appointment?
  4. What strength side do you expect the Saints to field tomorrow and do you think the club is bothered about the FA Cup, given your precarious league position?
  5. If its a weekend side, do agree with that?
  6. Nathan Jones was famed for playing quite a pragmatic style with limited players at Luton. What formation and style do you usually play under him at Saints?
  7. Of the squad you expect to play, who are your dangermen?  
  8. The two clubs have met six times in the FA Cup.  Whats your guess for your wins v ours?  Its 4-2 to them BTW!
  9. The last time we played each other in the FA Cup was a round three tie at St Marys, when we were in the Premier League and you were on League One!  Given our shite record in the cup, you naturally won 2-0.  Do you remember that one?  Lee Barnard and Guly with the goals

Jason Puncheon, Rickie Lambert and Brett Ormerod playing in the that game for both clubs

And finally, score predictions?


Our starting eleven v Saints


News


  • Huddersfield match postponement due to frozen pitch
  • Big Mick’s first press conference
  • Williams returns to Liverpool
  • Charlie Goode - Signed on loan till end of the season from Brentford.  A six foot five unit!
  • Report it app.  Unreal grassing on fans app released by the club, WTF are they thinking?

content.value:
It’s Sunday 8th January 2023, in this evening's show, we purr over a giant-killing FA Cup performance yesterday as the ‘Pool destroyed the Florists to make it into the bag for the fourth-round.


SEASIDE SEVEN

  1. Andy Lyons makes his debut.. Thoughts on the new boy and the starting eleven.
  2. Marv is back in the goals and back on form. Cause of this?
  3. Poveda power - Has the real Poveda, finally stood up? Brilliant performance and goal.
  4. Subs spot on and the impact of Jezza.
  5. Excellent performance, goal and the renaissance of CJ.
  6. A hat trick (of misses) for Sturridge.
  7. Appleton's tangerine army chanted (very faint). Fickle or what?! Steve Cooper not giving one ounce of credit to Blackpool in a post-match interview.



EXTRA TIME

  1. VAR - In some cup ties and not in others, what a mess! Thoughts on this.
  2. The sparse home crowd. Why? The third round of the FA used to be one of the most special games in the football calendar.
  3. New signings Morgan Rogers and of course Josh Bowler re-resigning. What else do we need in the squad to stay up, if anything?

title: Blackpool 1 - Sunderland 1 : REACTION
subtitle: The ‘Pool just about get a point against the high-flying Black Cats at Bloomfield Road
summary: It’s Sunday 1st January 2023, and in the first pod of the new year, we are discussing the ‘Pool just about getting a point against the high-flying Black Cats at Bloomfield Road this afternoon, a result which extends our run without a win to nine games, four points from a possible twenty-seven and see’s further pressure mount on manager, Michael Appleton.#blackpoolfc #sunderlandSEASIDE SEVENThe lineup seems like one big middle finger to the support. Grimmy dropped, Yates left out…Good first half. Fast and incisive football. Put pressure on and maintained it for spells. Best we've played since when? (Is Poveda the greatest player on earth?). Lavery composed finish and cool through ball from CJ.Sunderland second-half switch - Did they go to 3 at the back and put extra in the middleSloppy seconds - For the second game running, sloppy misplaced passes throughout the match. Whats the cause of this? Players or coaching?Sunderland onslaught - How many chances did Sunderland have? Hit the bar twice, a mad scramble that somehow stayed out. Tailors dummy - Second half totally overrun in midfield, Appleton just stood there watching it happen, and did nothing to affect change. Does he watch the same game as us? Why not stiffen the midfield?Booooo Appleton or ref booed? Seemed to be laughing when the booing started but I thought it was aimed at the ref.SUPPORTIf you would like to help support our show and help us pay for software, hosting, equipment, etc., please consider joining our Patreon supporter program.In return, you'll get extra content, early releases, access to our private Patreon WhatsApp chat group, and the odd giveaway now and then. To find out more go to:https://www.patreon.com/seasiderspodFOLLOWYou can follow us on the following platforms:YOUTUBEhttps://www.youtube.com/@seasiderspodTWITTERhttps://twitter.com/seasiderspodWEBSITEhttps://www.seasiderspodcast.co.uk/FACEBOOKhttps://www.facebook.com/seasiderspodPODCASTS APPhttps://podfollow.com/seasiders-podcast Hosted on Acast. content.value:
It’s Sunday 1st January 2023, and in the first pod of the new year, we are discussing the ‘Pool just about getting a point against the high-flying Black Cats at Bloomfield Road this afternoon, a result which extends our run without a win to nine games, four points from a possible twenty-seven and see’s further pressure mount on manager, Michael Appleton.

#blackpoolfc #sunderland


SEASIDE SEVEN

  1. The lineup seems like one big middle finger to the support. Grimmy dropped, Yates left out…
  2. Good first half. Fast and incisive football. Put pressure on and maintained it for spells. Best we've played since when? (Is Poveda the greatest player on earth?). Lavery composed finish and cool through ball from CJ.
  3. Sunderland second-half switch - Did they go to 3 at the back and put extra in the middle
  4. Sloppy seconds - For the second game running, sloppy misplaced passes throughout the match. Whats the cause of this? Players or coaching?
  5. Sunderland onslaught - How many chances did Sunderland have? Hit the bar twice, a mad scramble that somehow stayed out.
  6. Tailors dummy - Second half totally overrun in midfield, Appleton just stood there watching it happen, and did nothing to affect change. Does he watch the same game as us? Why not stiffen the midfield?
  7. Booooo Appleton or ref booed? Seemed to be laughing when the booing started but I thought it was aimed at the ref.

content.value:
It’s Friday 30th December 2022, and in this final pod of the year, we discuss the future of Michael Appelton and our potential for Championship survival as ‘Pool as we narrowly lost to Sheffield United in front of the Sky Cameras at Bloomfield Road last night.


PRE MATCH

  1. Two one all draws away at Cardiff and Hull since last pod
  2. The winless run stretched to eight games after today, although unbeaten in three
  3. Three points out of a possible twenty-four thus far


SEASIDE SEVEN

  1. Good first ten - Couple of good half chances, Poveda hits the bar on six minutes and a positive start to the game.
  2. Shite second ten  - Sheff United then on top and Sandje Berge all the time in the world to pick his spot after good work form Ndiaye. Carey at fault for not getting across his man?
  3. Switch - Beesley and Yates switched from left to right on around 30 minutes. What was MA trying to achieve? Bogle getting in the down the right all the time maybe having something to do with it?
  4. Sloppy - in possession and giving the ball away easily on numerous occasions. Thompson is particularly poor in his distribution, Madine gets frustrated with his service over his head all the time
  5. Tommo’s Christmas present - McAtee runs length off pitch after Carey slips, unchallenged to pass the ball home. Thompson not coming across to meet the man was criminal
  6. Back in it - Big Gaz brilliantly headed a corner back across the box, Spud couldn't miss. Did we look more dangerous going direct?
  7. Second half improvement - was a better performance and maybe deserved a point but had Sheff U taken their foot off the gas?


POST MATCH

  1. Clappleton not going over to away fans-gate. Damned if he does, damned if he doesn't?
  2. Sunderland at home next on NYD
  3. Appleton back or sack?

title: Blackpool 0 - Birmingham City 0 : REACTION
subtitle: We discuss yesterday's dreary nil-nil draw as ‘Pool returned to Championship action at a baltic Bloomfield Road.
summary: It’s Sunday the 11th of December 2022, in this evening’s first pod for a while, we discuss yesterday's dreary nil-nil draw as ‘Pool returned to Championship action at a baltic Bloomfield Road where we witnessed a performance that did little to warm the hearts of the hardy souls who braved the almost sub-zero terraces and stands.#blackpoolfc #birminghamcitySEASIDE SEVEN No Grimmy, again Lucky to not be behind, two or three down by halftime Second half worse than the first? Are we 'just stuck with him' or not? Should we stick or twist? If you were given his job tomorrow - how would you change it? Flat as a pancake - Deadest atmosphere at Bloomfield Rd in recent times. Nothing at the end of the match Williams improving? - Is Williams actually not quite as shit as we thought. A good point? Did a 0-0 draw with no shots on target exceed our expectations and does that say a lot about where we are?OTHER STUFF Critchley is confirmed as new QPR manager, head coach, or whatever.  Thoughts? FA Cup round three draw, home to Notts Forrest Recruitment team changes, is this an admission of failure?  Chris Badlam will manage the sporting and performance departments at the Club, including the support staff around the First-Team, Development Squad and Academy. Club and Trust opening up the club as a winter warm up hubSUPPORTIf you would like to help support our show and help us pay for software, hosting, equipment, etc., please consider joining our Patreon supporter program.In return, you'll get extra content, early releases, access to our private Patreon WhatsApp chat group and the odd giveaway now and then.  To find out more go to:https://www.patreon.com/seasiderspodFOLLOWYou can follow us on the following platforms:YOUTUBEhttps://www.youtube.com/@seasiderspodTWITTERhttps://twitter.com/seasiderspodWEBSITEhttps://www.seasiderspodcast.co.uk/FACEBOOKhttps://www.facebook.com/seasiderspodPODCASTS APPhttps://podfollow.com/seasiders-podcast Hosted on Acast. content.value:
It’s Sunday the 11th of December 2022, in this evening’s first pod for a while, we discuss yesterday's dreary nil-nil draw as ‘Pool returned to Championship action at a baltic Bloomfield Road where we witnessed a performance that did little to warm the hearts of the hardy souls who braved the almost sub-zero terraces and stands.

#blackpoolfc #birminghamcity

SEASIDE SEVEN

  1. No Grimmy, again
  2. Lucky to not be behind, two or three down by halftime
  3. Second half worse than the first?
  4. Are we 'just stuck with him' or not? Should we stick or twist? If you were given his job tomorrow - how would you change it?
  5. Flat as a pancake - Deadest atmosphere at Bloomfield Rd in recent times. Nothing at the end of the match
  6. Williams improving? - Is Williams actually not quite as shit as we thought.
  7. A good point? Did a 0-0 draw with no shots on target exceed our expectations and does that say a lot about where we are?

OTHER STUFF

  1. Critchley is confirmed as new QPR manager, head coach, or whatever.  Thoughts?
  2. FA Cup round three draw, home to Notts Forrest
  3. Recruitment team changes, is this an admission of failure?  Chris Badlam will manage the sporting and performance departments at the Club, including the support staff around the First-Team, Development Squad and Academy.
  4. Club and Trust opening up the club as a winter warm up hub

title: Wigan Athletic 2 - Blackpool 1 : REACTION
subtitle: Discussing the future of Michael Appleton as the ‘Pool crashed to their fourth defeat on the bounce against lowly and managerless Wigan
summary: It's Wednesday 16th November 2022, in this evening’s show we are discussing the future of Michael Appleton as the ‘Pool crashed to their fourth defeat on the bounce against lowly and managerless Wigan at the DW Stadium last Saturday, as we go into the Word Cup break in the relegation zoneSEASIDE SEVEN The turnout  - Around 3,500 fans in attendance, great support although deafened by the loudest ever PA system known to man.  And the last post - was weirdly applauded and also disrespected by some fans The goalkeeper  - Maxwell keeps the shirt, what has Grimmy done to not get a look in given Maxwell's indifferent form?  Spoke to Grimmy in Costa. Three changes for the Seasiders fixture against Connolly, Williams and Lavery all start Marv was sent off again - Terrible decision-making yet again, sent off and is regressing badly this season, a liability almost.  Does anyone care to speculate the reasons why?  And was it a pen? Big Gaz Boom!  -  Dragged one wide early doors but what a strike from Madine, hunger, desire and great technical ability. Corner fiasco  - Never a corner in the first place but laughable defending.  No one marking either post. Who’s to blame for that? On Tilt to score the winner. With the constant barrage of balls into the box in the second half, no surprise Wigan eventually put one in. Sacked in the morning - Our responses to hearing thatTALKING POINT Post-match policing operation in Wigan.  Blackpool fans were batoned and assaulted by GMP on the walk back to the train station.SUPPORTIf you would like to help support our show and help us pay for software, hosting, equipment, etc., please consider joining our Patreon supporter program.In return, you'll get extra content, early releases, access to our private Patreon WhatsApp chat group and the odd giveaway now and then.  To find out more go to:https://www.patreon.com/seasiderspodFOLLOWYou can follow us on the following platforms:YOUTUBEhttps://www.youtube.com/@seasiderspodTWITTERhttps://twitter.com/seasiderspodWEBSITEhttps://www.seasiderspodcast.co.uk/FACEBOOKhttps://www.facebook.com/seasiderspodPODCASTS APPhttps://podfollow.com/seasiders-podcast Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

content.value:
It's Wednesday 16th November 2022, in this evening’s show we are discussing the future of Michael Appleton as the ‘Pool crashed to their fourth defeat on the bounce against lowly and managerless Wigan at the DW Stadium last Saturday, as we go into the Word Cup break in the relegation zone

SEASIDE SEVEN

  1. The turnout  - Around 3,500 fans in attendance, great support although deafened by the loudest ever PA system known to man.  And the last post - was weirdly applauded and also disrespected by some fans
  2. The goalkeeper  - Maxwell keeps the shirt, what has Grimmy done to not get a look in given Maxwell's indifferent form?  Spoke to Grimmy in Costa. Three changes for the Seasiders fixture against Connolly, Williams and Lavery all start
  3. Marv was sent off again - Terrible decision-making yet again, sent off and is regressing badly this season, a liability almost.  Does anyone care to speculate the reasons why?  And was it a pen?
  4. Big Gaz Boom!  -  Dragged one wide early doors but what a strike from Madine, hunger, desire and great technical ability.
  5. Corner fiasco  - Never a corner in the first place but laughable defending.  No one marking either post. Who’s to blame for that?
  6. On Tilt to score the winner. With the constant barrage of balls into the box in the second half, no surprise Wigan eventually put one in.
  7. Sacked in the morning - Our responses to hearing that

TALKING POINT

  1. Post-match policing operation in Wigan.  Blackpool fans were batoned and assaulted by GMP on the walk back to the train station.

SEASIDE SEVEN

  • Decision making

  1. Jezza shanks -

summary: It's Sunday 30th October 2022, and in this evening's show, we will be purring over a Gary Goals-inspired victory which saw “a team like Blackpool” overturn a half-time deficit to come away with all three points at the Coventry Building Society Arena.#coventrycity #blackpoolfcWelcome Kev & PeteKev Owers & Pete DixonTalking points M6 a nightmare on the journey there but made it thanks to Siri and Jimmy Hill way Unseasonable warmth, twenty degrees C Great start, Carey slotting Madine in, should have scored but great timing over the run.  Tried to dink the GK. Patino nailed, the first yellow of the game to them.  Booked my Mr.Bond who looks like a grey-haired former Mod! The resulting free kicking played into the box by Dougall, broke to Thorniley on the edge, floated into Madine and back post but pokes it over the bar when free, karate kick stretching. Cov hit the post, the ball in from the right, and Charlie Allen hit the post.  Did Maxi get a toe on it? Evoesque diag from Connolly finds Carey on the left.  Beautiful first touch, dummies defender and drills the base of the post GOAL - Palmer megs Jud to put Cov ahead, great build-up to the goal. DIASSLOWED GOAL - CJ judged offside after Madine header goalbound.  Did he touch it? GOAL!  Madine intercepts the backpass, sets up Hubby's cross and a glancing header Connolly blazes over after great move and cross from Patino Two more Cov chances, close GOAL!  Yates header!  7 in 5 and top scorer in the league.  A great cross from CJ, Madine-esque header.SUPPORT--------------If you would like to help support our show and help us pay for software, hosting, equipment, etc, please consider joining our Patreon supporter program.In return, you'll get extra content, early releases, access to our private Patreon WhatsApp chat group and the odd giveaway now and then.  To find out more go to:https://www.patreon.com/seasiderspodFOLLOW-------------You can follow us on the following platforms:YOUTUBEhttps://www.youtube.com/@seasiderspodTWITTERhttps://twitter.com/seasiderspodWEBSITEhttps://www.seasiderspodcast.co.uk/FACEBOOKhttps://www.facebook.com/seasiderspodPODCASTS APPhttps://podfollow.com/seasiders-podcast Hosted on Acast. It's Sunday 30th October 2022, and in this evening's show, we will be purring over a Gary Goals-inspired victory which saw “a team like Blackpool” overturn a half-time deficit to come away with all three points at the Coventry Building Society Arena.

#coventrycity #blackpoolfc

Welcome Kev & Pete

Kev Owers & Pete Dixon

Talking points

  • M6 a nightmare on the journey there but made it thanks to Siri and Jimmy Hill way
  • Unseasonable warmth, twenty degrees C
  • Great start, Carey slotting Madine in, should have scored but great timing over the run.  Tried to dink the GK.
  • Patino nailed, the first yellow of the game to them.  Booked my Mr.Bond who looks like a grey-haired former Mod!
  • The resulting free kicking played into the box by Dougall, broke to Thorniley on the edge, floated into Madine and back post but pokes it over the bar when free, karate kick stretching.
  • Cov hit the post, the ball in from the right, and Charlie Allen hit the post.  Did Maxi get a toe on it?
  • Evoesque diag from Connolly finds Carey on the left.  Beautiful first touch, dummies defender and drills the base of the post
  • GOAL - Palmer megs Jud to put Cov ahead, great build-up to the goal.
  • DIASSLOWED GOAL - CJ judged offside after Madine header goalbound.  Did he touch it?
  • GOAL!  Madine intercepts the backpass, sets up Hubby's cross and a glancing header
  • Connolly blazes over after great move and cross from Patino
  • Two more Cov chances, close
  • GOAL!  Yates header!  7 in 5 and top scorer in the league.  A great cross from CJ, Madine-esque header.

title: Blackpool 4 - PNE 2 : REACTION
summary: It's Sunday 23rd of October. In this evening's show, we review the pulsating West Lancs derby at Bloomfield Road yesterday, as a clinical 'Pool despatched their arch-rivals from down the M55 in a glorious afternoon for all in tangerine and white! PNE have conceded over 36% of their season goals to Blackpool Up to 18th on 19th points.  Three points behind the Nobbers with a game in hand.  Last five games, won 2, drew 2, lost 1. PNe players to impress - Lindsay centre half. Storey right back.  Whiteman centre mid.  Woodburn was handy in the ten. For once, ‘Pool were deadly in front of goal which has been a criticism throughout the season.  What a time to turn things around in that department! Big up to the referee, Chris Kavanah. Outstanding performance in a frantic local derby. Atmosphere - absolutely throughout Policing operation afterwards, horses on Bloomfield RoadSUPPORT--------------If you would like to help support our show and help us pay for software, hosting, equipment, etc, please consider joining our Patreon supporter program.In return, you'll get extra content, early releases, access to our private Patreon WhatsApp chat group and the odd giveaway now and then.  To find out more go to:https://www.patreon.com/seasiderspodFOLLOW-------------You can follow us on the following platforms:YOUTUBEhttps://www.youtube.com/@seasiderspodTWITTERhttps://twitter.com/seasiderspodWEBSITEhttps://www.seasiderspodcast.co.uk/FACEBOOKhttps://www.facebook.com/seasiderspodPODCASTS APPhttps://podfollow.com/seasiders-podcast Hosted on Acast. title: Blackpool v PNE : PREVIEW
summary: It's Thursday 20th October 2022, in this evening's special West Lancs derby day preview, we are once again joined by our chum from down the M55, Tom Harrison who will be helping us build-up to Saturday's much anticipated “Battle of Bloomfield Road”.PNE So Tom  P16 W5 D7 L4 GF9 GA10 9th on 22points and two points off the playoffs. On paper, a good start to the season - give us your thoughts.   You’ve currently got the best away record in the division, do you think that will be a factor in tomorrow's game? Conversely, you're in the bottom three for home form, only recording one victory at Deepdale all season.  What do you put this down to? Does it bother you barely see any goals or entertainment as long as you are picking up results? What do you and other PNE fans think of HaalandWatch? Tell us about the form players in Preston's team and players we should watch out for.  Riis, Parrott and Greg Cunnigham are all hitting form I believe? Any injuries? Has Ben Woodburn turned out to be as shite as we all said he would be? Onto the day itself, what are your plans? The police operation is blocking off large swathes of roads usually used by Blackpool fans, including Bloomfield Road.  The police at Preston rightly kept ‘Pool fans behind at Deepdale for nearly an hour.  What is the police's obsession with forcing all fans out at the same time? The ticket situation has again reared its head again - what do you think of your allocation no doubt it will be reciprocated at Deepdale. iFollow Finally, match predictionsTeam pickerOur team to beat the NobbersHull Reaction Thoughts on the matchSUPPORT--------------If you would like to help support our show and help us pay for software, hosting, equipment, etc, please consider joining our Patreon supporter program.In return, you'll get extra content, early releases, access to our private Patreon WhatsApp chat group and the odd giveaway now and then.  To find out more go to:https://www.patreon.com/seasiderspodFOLLOW-------------You can follow us on the following platforms:YOUTUBEhttps://www.youtube.com/@seasiderspodTWITTERhttps://twitter.com/seasiderspodWEBSITEhttps://www.seasiderspodcast.co.uk/FACEBOOKhttps://www.facebook.com/seasiderspodPODCASTS APPhttps://podfollow.com/seasiders-podcast Hosted on Acast. Thoughts? Away kit with tangerine socks, looked awesome imo! Great start but two down after twenty minutes - a common pattern this season - why? A brace of braces for Jezza, what caused the upturn in form? Brilliant performance from Lavery, discuss. Dougall puts us three two up with a sliding finish Bridcutt head injury, gets ignored by the twat that is David Webb Marv red, silly challenge really.  Thorniley was covering Thomspn red after a dual assault into boards from their lad.  Petulant kick of the ball, but worthy of a red, really? Williams and CJ on Disallowed Sheff U goal for offside and missed two sitters, one from Bash Their laughable penalty and miss.  David Webb must have the Blades on his acca! Connolly handball 8 mins of injury time, two incredible saves from Maxi in the period McBurney nails Maxwell, three of their players then obscure Maxi in offside positions and Norwood smashes it home.  Heartbreak. CJ nearly winning it for ‘Pool at the deathPost-match Appleton clearly not happy with the officials, great to see him wading in and to quote MCLF “The body warmer twat would have run a mile.” Lavery being sent off for being body slammed by Fodderimgham Lavery three-game game ban, misses nob end.  Thompson and Marv, one game ban Stewards kicking off with fans - what happened?Media reaction Laughable EFL highlights show not even discussing the referee's performance Michael Dawson on SSN saying Webb got everything correct and did a good jobHull Preview/News Pick the team for the match out of the scraps of a squad! It's Sunday 16th October 2022, in this evening's show, we discuss four red cards, six goals, a two-goal deficit overturned, a missed penalty, a mass brawl and a referee as bent as a Uri Geller spoon! 

Sheffield United 3 - Blackpool 3 

#sheffutd #blackpoolfc

  • Madine not taking a knee! Thoughts?
  • Away kit with tangerine socks, looked awesome imo!
  • Great start but two down after twenty minutes - a common pattern this season - why?
  • A brace of braces for Jezza, what caused the upturn in form?
  • Brilliant performance from Lavery, discuss.
  • Dougall puts us three two up with a sliding finish
  • Bridcutt head injury, gets ignored by the twat that is David Webb
  • Marv red, silly challenge really.  Thorniley was covering
  • Thomspn red after a dual assault into boards from their lad.  Petulant kick of the ball, but worthy of a red, really?
  • Williams and CJ on
  • Disallowed Sheff U goal for offside and missed two sitters, one from Bash
  • Their laughable penalty and miss.  David Webb must have the Blades on his acca!
  • Connolly handball
  • 8 mins of injury time, two incredible saves from Maxi in the period
  • McBurney nails Maxwell, three of their players then obscure Maxi in offside positions and Norwood smashes it home.  Heartbreak.
  • CJ nearly winning it for ‘Pool at the death

Post-match

  • Appleton clearly not happy with the officials, great to see him wading in and to quote MCLF “The body warmer twat would have run a mile.”
  • Lavery being sent off for being body slammed by Fodderimgham
  • Lavery three-game game ban, misses nob end.  Thompson and Marv, one game ban
  • Stewards kicking off with fans - what happened?

Media reaction

  • Laughable EFL highlights show not even discussing the referee's performance
  • Michael Dawson on SSN saying Webb got everything correct and did a good job

Hull Preview/News

title: Pyros, Prices, Swansea & Barrow
summary: In this evening’s late-night preview show, we are taking a look at Saturday's fixture against the Swans and also looking back on the shit show against Barrow as the ‘Pool were dumped out of the Carabao Cup at the first hurdle. Also looking at the latest news and developments from Bloomfield Road.Topics Barrow in the Carabao Cup None of our kids in starting line up? First half woeful Lavery unlucky or not good enough? Dare we speak of CJ again…? Ratings or just quick MOM/villain of the match? (Patino not mom!) Ticket prices for Burnley away Club response (see Sean's article - basically, no parachute money,competing with big clubs and official coaches are cheap) Obviously looking to cash in our status as preferred away day. Is away travel going to be in jeopardy as fuel prices and energy prices create cashflow concerns for many? Where does this leave our model? Whilst sympathetic to the difficulty of the club competing and wifet rising costs (the club has energy bill too for example) should we not be pressing for reasonable pricing across all football? Which includes our own club… is the bigger picture what counts? Keogh has gone to Ipswich. Is it good business and a natural end of a great but ultimately aging player or could we have got a year out of him? Is it a sign of the manager building *his* dressing room by being keen to move on a major personality in Critch's team? Fave Keogh moment/general Keogh appreciation (he deserves it) What does this mean for the defence? Swansea at home preview Previous games (obvs 6-3 but what else?) Swan and a Seasider (played for both) Will it be as boring as previous Critch v Russell Martin games? Sean explains to us stuff that only he knows about Swansea. Pick our team The great formatiom debate? PredictionsWorth talking about pyro bans? Football is keen to cash in on drinking and gamblimg but is taking a draconian approach to fan behaviour. Yes, pyros cleary can impact people with breathing issues but gambling and drinking adverts all over don't help people either…SUPPORT USIf you would like to help support our show and help us pay for software, hosting, equipment, etc, please consider joining our Patreon supporter program.You'll get extra content, early releases, and access to us and our private Patreon WhatsApp chat group in return.  To find out more and/or to sign up, go to:https://www.patreon.com/seasiderspod Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

content.value:
In this special Extraordinary General Podcast (EGP) we are reacting to the bolt-out-of-the-blue news, that Neil Critchley has left the building, having made the decision to carry Steven Gerard's bags as Aston Villa's assistant manager.


Talking Points

If you’re listening to this, you’ve probably heard the news. Blackpool Football Club has agreed to terms with Aston Villa for Neil Critchley to join them (and Steven Gerrard) as their new assistant manager. It follows Michael Beale vacating that post to become QPR Manager.


  1. How are we feeling?
  • March interview with the Gazette where he said ‘hopefully there are a few more years to come yet”
  • Was the connection with the fans a ploy to get us on his side?
  • Mitch on Critch
  1. It feels like an odd move - to go from an up-and-coming Championship side to #2 at a mid-table Premier League side. Beale clearly saw the reverse as a step up. Why do we think Neil Critchley has decided to leave the club?
  • Is it money for him personally? Better wages?
  • Relationship with Gerrard? (The two worked together in LFC’s youth set-up. Gerrard has said he was the “#1 choice” based on their previous work together)
  • Is it the supposed lack of transfer budget - dependent on selling Bowler?
  • The club is investing off the pitch; so it isn’t like the club is refusing to show ambition.
  1. Does moving in this way tarnish Critchley’s legacy?
  • Achievements on the pitch
  • Any comparison to Holloway?
  1. What next for Blackpool football club?
  • Presumably, we have compensation given Critchley was under contract to 2025
  • What should we be looking for in a new manager?
  • Who does this panel feel should get the job?
  1. Potential Replacements (ranked by BetVictor favorites)
  • Dave Challinor (6/1) - Stockport County
  • Michael Appleton (8/1) - just left Lincoln City
  • Michael Duff (8/1) - Cheltenham Town
  • Leam Richardson (8/1) - Wigan Athletic
  • Micky Mellon (10/1) - Tranmere Rovers, formerly Dundee
  • Gareth Ainsworth (10/1) - Wycombe Wanderers
  • John Coleman (12/1) - Accrington Stanley
  1. Takes players from non-league, and now able to perform in League One
  2. Lots of experience - but a bit more traditional
  • Tony Mowbray (12/1) - just left Blackburn Rovers
  • Jimmy Floyd Hasselbank (12/1) - Burton Albion
  • Simon Grayson (12/1) - sacked from Fleetwood

Other

  • Sean Dyche?
  • Surely he’ll sit tight and wait for Steve Bruce to be sacked?
  • Liam Manning from MK Dons?
  • Ian Evatt?
  • Wayne Rooney?
  • Michael Carrick?
  • Duncan Ferguson?
  • Mark Warburton?
  • Brian Barry-Murphy (City U23s Manager, formerly at Rochdale)
  • Kevin Betsy

content.value:
It's Friday 28th May 2021, in today's play-off final preview special, we are delighted to be joined on the pod by former ‘Pool and Lincoln legend GTF! Fletch, along with Jake Tongue, another guest, and Lincoln fan, will be helping us preview the big match, and give us his thoughts on what it takes to win a play-off final and how the current team compares to the famous class of 2010.


Ten questions with GTF

  • What are you up to at the moment Fletch, still involved in the game at all?
  • Have you been following the fortunes of both of your former clubs this season?
  • Are you surprised at how successful both have been?
  • We all know about your time at Blackpool and what you achieved, tell us about your time at Lincoln.
  • What do you know about the current Lincoln side and do you think they will be a threat in stopping Blackpool from getting promotion back to the Championship?
  • Do you know Michael Appleton at all and do you rate him as a manager?
  • How do you think the current Blackpool side compares with the famous class of 2010 in terms of both the quality and character of the players?
  • Who do you think are Blackpool’s dangermen and potential match winners?
  • What do you think will be going through the player's minds as they step out of the tunnel onto the Hallowed Wembley turf?
  • What does it take to win a play-off final, from a player's perspective?
  • Who will you be supporting in the final ;-)

title: The lowdown on CJ Hamilton
summary: It’s Thursday 23rd July and in this show I’m speaking to Craig Priest from the Mansfield Town fans podcast “Mansfield Matters” about Blackpool’s new signing CJ Hamilton and few bits about the mutual connections between us and the StagsAbout Craig, Mansfield Town and Mansfield Matters Craig, tell us about your podcast and a bit about yourself. So you finished in 21st place in League two on 38 points, I guess you’ve had better seasons? You dropped out of the league after the 07-08 season and spent SIX seasons in the conference eventually returning to the football league after winning the title in 2012-13.  What was it like playing in the conference and how tough a league is it to get out of? Notable ex players who’ve played for both include Gordon Owen, Neal Bishop and the most well known is probably Alex Baptiste. Baps played for you between 2002-2008 with 198 appearances in all competitions, so, is he a bit of a club legend considering he was also a local boy done-good, all the way to the Premier League?Blackpool have signed winger CJ Hamilton from Mansfield Town on a three-year deal for an undisclosed fee.The 25-year-old scored three goals in 41 games for the Stags in all competitions last season.He began his career at Sheffield United but left without playing a game and joined Mansfield in 2016 before going on to make 173 appearances.--- What was your initial reaction when you first found out he had been sold? Could you elaborate on his best position and what can we expect from him? How integral was he to your squad and how much will he be missed? Will you be sad to see him go? What is his temperament like? How do you think he’ll fit in under Neil Critchley's system at Blackpool playing ‘The Liverpool way’? How do you think he will get on at Blackpool? Do you think he has the potential to play at the higher grade? Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

content.value:
It’s Thursday 23rd July and in this show I’m speaking to Craig Priest from the Mansfield Town fans podcast “Mansfield Matters” about Blackpool’s new signing CJ Hamilton and few bits about the mutual connections between us and the Stags

About Craig, Mansfield Town and Mansfield Matters

  • Craig, tell us about your podcast and a bit about yourself.
  • So you finished in 21st place in League two on 38 points, I guess you’ve had better seasons?
  • You dropped out of the league after the 07-08 season and spent SIX seasons in the conference eventually returning to the football league after winning the title in 2012-13.  What was it like playing in the conference and how tough a league is it to get out of?
  • Notable ex players who’ve played for both include Gordon Owen, Neal Bishop and the most well known is probably Alex Baptiste.
  • Baps played for you between 2002-2008 with 198 appearances in all competitions, so, is he a bit of a club legend considering he was also a local boy done-good, all the way to the Premier League?

Blackpool have signed winger CJ Hamilton from Mansfield Town on a three-year deal for an undisclosed fee.

The 25-year-old scored three goals in 41 games for the Stags in all competitions last season.

He began his career at Sheffield United but left without playing a game and joined Mansfield in 2016 before going on to make 173 appearances.

---

  • What was your initial reaction when you first found out he had been sold?
  • Could you elaborate on his best position and what can we expect from him?
  • How integral was he to your squad and how much will he be missed?
  • Will you be sad to see him go?
  • What is his temperament like?
  • How do you think he’ll fit in under Neil Critchley's system at Blackpool playing ‘The Liverpool way’?
  • How do you think he will get on at Blackpool?
  • Do you think he has the potential to play at the higher grade?

title: The lowdown on Keshi Anderson and Jerry Yates
summary: I’m speaking to Rich Pullen from the Swindon Town podcast “The Loathed Stranger” who’s going to give us the low-down and what to expect out of Blackpool’s new signing Keshi Anderson First off, congratulations on your promotion and league title and we’ll be seeing you next season! Tell us about the name of your pod, whats the story? How does it feel to get promoted on these terms and does it take the gloss off it considering you’ve been top for five months?! I believe you are having a virtual open bus tour to celebrate?   • How do you think you’ll do next season and which players

Now onto Keshi Anderson
